item.title: Comment on Can Early Intervention Make a Difference in Autism? by Fred Osim
item.dc:creator: Fred Osim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../../can-early-intervention-make-a-difference/index.html#comment-619">Eve Mitchell</a>.
Hi Eve, yes, early intervention can make a difference in Autism in that skills needed to function effectively are taught earlier and the gaps in developmental milestones are filled up. We join you to pray that it helps him get back on top of his school work.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Eve Mitchell.

Hi Eve, yes, early intervention can make a difference in Autism in that skills needed to function effectively are taught earlier and the gaps in developmental milestones are filled up. We join you to pray that it helps him get back on top of his school work.

item.title: Comment on Can Early Intervention Make a Difference in Autism? by Eve Mitchell
item.dc:creator: Eve Mitchell
item.description: It's good to know that early intervention treatment can be really effective for children with autism. My son has autism, and he's falling really behind in reading and literacy at school this year. I'm hoping that an intervention program can help him get back on top of his school work.
item.content:encoded: It’s good to know that early intervention treatment can be really effective for children with autism. My son has autism, and he’s falling really behind in reading and literacy at school this year. I’m hoping that an intervention program can help him get back on top of his school work.

item.title: Comment on Know the signs of Autism by Victor Iki
item.dc:creator: Victor Iki
item.description:
I am a licensed Occupational Therapist practicing in Nigeria. I watched your program on national tv and got interested in what you are doing. I commend your good work.
I would like to know how I can collaborate with you on managing these special kids.
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
I am a licensed Occupational Therapist practicing in Nigeria. I watched your program on national tv and got interested in what you are doing. I commend your good work.

I would like to know how I can collaborate with you on managing these special kids.

Thanks
